info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 12:37AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Henry and southwestern Bureau Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1237 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodhull, or 10 miles southwest of Cambridge, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Galva around 1250 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kewanee. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 28 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
